intro: Mertensia longiflora f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking white petals and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
